result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L Spears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth L Spears is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth L Spears was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence , but granted defendant credit for 14 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Fine in the amount of $250.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges by 11-23-17 or 15 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

01-21-16/ Judge John Siefert
The Court ordered that the JOC is amended to give the defendant a TOTAL of 67 days of sentence credit.
NO Huber. COURT OBJECTS TO electronic monitoring, credit for 67 days time served. Give DNA sample.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Granting Additional Sentence Credit, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
Defendant's pre se request for additional sentence credit.

Probation having been revoked, sentencing proceeded.  Statements by each counsel and defendant.

The court sentenced defendant to serve NINE MONTHS in the House of Correction with NO Huber privileges , COURT OBJECTS TO  electronic monitoring, credit for 53 days time served. Give DNA sample. 

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges by 11-23-17 or 15 consecutive days in the House of Correction. 

 Information on Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation

[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( X )  SENTENCE AFTER REVOCATION
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Kenneth L Spears in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 14 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
*aoda/any treatment deemed appropriate/random urine screens
*pay all municipal tickets
*fine in the amount of $250.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth L Spears in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count ONE: 

  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

On motion of the state, court ordered counts two and three:  Dismissed.

Court ordered cash bail increased by $100.00. Cash bail set at $350.00. All other conditions remain in effect.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Kenneth L Spears not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED by the Court. Bail: $250.00 CASH TO REMAIN.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kenneth L Spears in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Kenneth L Spears in custody.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.
